programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive needs a new shop truck, Bill and the guys go sky-high with a lifted '21 F-450 King Ranch capable of hauling over 20,000 pounds; with most of the '46 Ford Coupe body beyond repair, the team has no choice but to build from the ground up.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.sub-title: 700 Horsepower & 2,400 Miles! Crusher Camaro Engine Swap Aftermath
programme.desc: David and Mike reveal what it's really like to work at HOT ROD Magazine; they give the behind-the-scenes dirt on how they pull everything off.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.sub-title: Back to the Track in the '56 Chevy Field Car!
programme.desc: The '56 Chevy Field Car gets ready for the drag strip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern, Cotten, and Finnegan participate in an unusual race that requires their boat to survive the competitors' attacks on a dirt track.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: This time around, Freiburger and Finnegan travel to Santa Rosa, Calif., to drive a crazy '74 Mazda REPU mini-truck all the way back to SoCal, where they'll compete in Optima's Search for the Ultimate Street Car Challenge.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: After more than three years of planning, the "Roadkill" guys finally transform a 1970 Chevrolet Monte Carlo into a beast called the Nascarlo.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's the mullet-car showdown, a battle of dirt-cheap beaters: an SN95 Mustang V-6 and a third-gen Camaro with a 305 that's so gutless it might as well be a V-6.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Freiburger take on a 1950 Ford F6 dump truck, shorten the wheelbase, add a supercharged big-block Chevy with a Gearstar 4L80E transmission, and a V-drive from a boat.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: People love it when the crew rescues old cars from the junkyard; they literally hack a '56 Buick Century out of a thorn bush it's been sitting in for 25 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1991 Cadillac Brougham is converted into the swingin' Broughammer with a Cummins turbodiesel; with special guests Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa of "Hot Rod Garage."

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.sub-title: Dyno and Drag in the Crusher Impala!
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich tune up the supercharged big block in the '69 Crusher Impala at Westech's dyno before hitting the road and the dragstrip. The guys run the Impala's fastest time in the quarter mile, but discover some new Roadkill-level issues.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.sub-title: Off-Road Challenger and Subaru Rally Course!
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich and Wiley Stevens up the cam game on the Off-Road Challenger, while also seeing if Wiley's '06 Subaru can be made into a rally-capable daily driver with suspension and airflow upgrades.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freibuger and Dulcich can't pass up buying a '41 Ford former race car that last saw action in some road races back in the late '90s; with tuning, a carburetor rebuild, exhaust modifications and some love, the guys get the Ford back on the open road.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong join Dulcich to bring new life to the car with a shifter upgrade, new clutch and a near-full rear quarter panel replacement.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten surprise Finnegan with a 2.3L 1980 Pinto wagon and drift lessons from pro Formula Drift driver Federico Sceriffo; they add a 396ci stroker engine and suspension mods before taking on a 1,000-plus-hp Ferrari 599 GTB.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Roadkill survived 50 episodes and in that time, we've built a whole lot of cars; in this episode we've got a shootout of the 10 that are still running and driving.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich give some much-needed love to the '69 Chevy Crusher Impala by way of a new 9-inch rear and a suspension overhaul. They also fix a major throttle issue that unlocks the 498 big block before hitting the road for monster burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in a '66 Chevy Chevelle purchased sight unseen in an attempt to score two new project cars. The guys fix and tune their way from Washington to Arizona to rescue a dirt-cheap junkyard '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The LS-powered S-15 mini truck gets a revamp when the guys fix what didn't work from the last time they raced Randy Pobst around a road course in a Shelby GT350.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.sub-title: 700 Horsepower & 2,400 Miles! Crusher Camaro Engine Swap Aftermath
programme.desc: David and Mike reveal what it's really like to work at HOT ROD Magazine; they give the behind-the-scenes dirt on how they pull everything off.
